meanings.definition: The quality or state of being reducible.
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained the reducibilities of the math problem to the students.
meanings.sent2: The reducibilities of the budget allowed for more flexibility in spending.
meanings.sent3: The reducibilities of the jigsaw puzzle made it easier to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was like the reducibilities of a rubber band, always stretching to accommodate others.
meanings.sent5: The reducibilities of the clay made it easy for the sculptor to shape it into different forms.

meanings.definition: The ability to be reduced in size, amount, or complexity.
meanings.sent1: The company's success was due to the reducibilities of its production costs.
meanings.sent2: The reducibilities of the recipe allowed for easy adjustments to suit different tastes.
meanings.sent3: The reducibilities of the traffic congestion turned the daily commute into a game of strategy.
meanings.sent4: His creativity had the reducibilities of a magician, transforming ordinary ideas into extraordinary creations.
meanings.sent5: The reducibilities of the data made it easier to analyze and draw meaningful conclusions.
